titleStmt.title: A treasure of health By Castor Durante Da Gualdo, physician and citizen of Rome. Wherein is shewn how to preserve health, and prolong life. Also the nature of all sorts of meats and drinks, with the way to prevent all hurt that attends the use of either of them. Translated out of Italian into English, by John Chamberlayne, Gent. Imprimatur, April 5. 1686. Rob. Midgley.
De bonitate et vitio alimentorum centuria. English
titleStmt.author: Durante, Castore, 1529-1590.

titleStmt.title: A treasure of health By Castor Durante Da Gualdo, physician and citizen of Rome. Wherein is shewn how to preserve health, and prolong life. Also the nature of all sorts of meats and drinks, with the way to prevent all hurt that attends the use of either of them. Translated out of Italian into English, by John Chamberlayne, Gent. Imprimatur, April 5. 1686. Rob. Midgley.
De bonitate et vitio alimentorum centuria. English

Chamberlayne, John, 1666-1723.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for William Crook, at the Green Dragon without Temple-Bar,
